attributes.action: value the lives of African people above commodities.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following the previous conflict in Congo, the UN carried out an investigation into the causes of the war and found that the country was ravaged by "armies of business", commanded by men who "carefully planned the redrawing of the regional map to redistribute wealth." In 2002/3, the UN reported on international corporations it believed were involved in the conflict in Congo - recommending companies such as Anglo-American PLC, Barclays Bank, Standard Chartered Bank and De Beers for further investigation. 
In the light of its’ humanitarian goals in Africa, we call on the Government to put significant pressure on all businesses involved in the Congo and surrounding countries (particularly those named in UN reports S/2002/1146 & S/2003/1027) to carry out a full ethical review of their policies, practice and business interests – one which values the lives of African people above commodities.
